wblut.geom

Class WB_Triangulate2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • wblut.geom.WB_Triangulate2D

  • public class WB_Triangulate2D
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a 2D triangulation using points (vertices) and halfedges. Triangulation is performed by an interactive constrained Delaunay algorithm. Point insertion uses Lawson's algorithm. Constraint insertion and removal, as well as vertex removal and relocation are supported. For full details, see the "Interactive Constrained Delaunay Triangulation" section of: Howison, M. CAD Tools for Creating Space-filling 3D Escher Tiles. Master’s thesis, U.C. Berkeley, Berkeley, CA, May 2009. (also Tech Report EECS-2009-56, http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Pubs/TechRpts/2009/EECS-2009-56.html) Or contact the author: mark.howison gmail com
    Author:
    Mark Howison

      • findFaceBruteForce

        public WB_Triangulate2D.Tri_FaceWalk findFaceBruteForce(WB_Triangulate2D.Tri_HalfEdge heStart,
                                               WB_Triangulate2D.Tri_Point p)
        This brute force approach works for *any* non-intersecting boundary, concave or convex. If the boundary is guaranteed to be a convex, a smarter face-walking algorithm could be used.

      • findFace

        public WB_Triangulate2D.Tri_FaceWalk findFace(WB_Triangulate2D.Tri_HalfEdge heStart,
                                     WB_Triangulate2D.Tri_Point p)
        A slightly smarter face walk routine that resorts to brute force only when it gets confused by an concave boundary.

        Returns:
